content: The "Children's Hospitals Education Equity and Research (CHEER) Act of 2005" is also known as the Children's Hospitals Graduate Medical Education Program reauthorization. The "Children's Hospitals Education Equity and Research (CHEER) Act of 2005" is being amended to extend the program until 2010. Changes are made to the Direct Graduate Medical Education and Nature of Payments sections of the Public Health Service Act. The "Children's Hospitals Education Equity and Research (CHEER) Act of 2005" is being amended to extend the program until 2010, with changes to the authorization of appropriations under the Public Health Service Act. The "CHEER Act of 2005" is amended to extend the program until 2010, with changes to the authorization of appropriations under the Public Health Service Act. Amendments include adjustments to funding amounts for fiscal years 2006 and 2007-2010, as well as technical amendments to specific sections. The Public Health Service Act is amended to extend funding availability for fiscal years starting in 2006. Amounts appropriated for a fiscal year will remain available for obligation through the end of the following fiscal year. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to Section 340E(b)(2)(A) of the Act. The Public Health Service Act is amended to extend funding availability for fiscal years starting in 2006. Amounts recouped from hospitals are to be redistributed to other hospitals in the same fiscal year, with finality unless fraud is involved. Appeals procedures under Section 340E(e) are also modified. The Public Health Service Act is amended to extend funding availability for fiscal years starting in 2006. Appeals regarding hospital payments under this section will be subject to review and handled expeditiously for timely reconciliation. Appeals regarding hospital payments under this section will be subject to review and handled expeditiously for timely reconciliation. A review decision will not affect payments for a fiscal year prior to the year in which the decision is rendered. The decision will be applied in determining payment for the appealing hospital in the year of the decision and subsequent years, unless there are amendments to the law or material differences in facts. The Public Health Service Act allows hospitals to seek review of determinations regarding payments for subsequent fiscal years without affecting payments for prior years.
